verses.text: And the child Samuel ministered unto the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** before Eli. And the word of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** was precious in those days; there was* no open vision.
And it came to pass at that time, when Eli was* laid down in his place, and his eyes began to wax dim, that* he could not see;
And ere the lamp of God went out in the temple of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, where the ark of God was*, and Samuel was laid down to sleep;*
That the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** called Samuel: and he answered, Here am* I.
And he ran unto Eli, and said, Here am* I; for thou calledst me. And he said, I called not; lie down again. And he went and lay down.
And the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** called yet again, Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, Here am* I; for thou didst call me. And he answered, I called not, my son; lie down again.

Now Samuel did not yet know the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**, neither was the word of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** yet revealed unto him.+ 3.7 Now…: or, Thus did Samuel before he knew the \+nd LORD\+nd*, and before the word of the \+nd LORD\+nd* was revealed unto him*

And the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** called Samuel again the third time. And he arose and went to Eli, and said, Here am* I; for thou didst call me. And Eli perceived that the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** had called the child.

Therefore Eli said unto Samuel, Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he call thee, that thou shalt say, Speak, \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**; for thy servant heareth. So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
And the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** came, and stood, and called as at other times, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel answered, Speak; for thy servant heareth.
¶ And the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** said to Samuel, Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle.
In that day I will perform against Eli all things* which I have spoken concerning his house: when I begin, I will also make an end.+ 3.12 when…: Heb. beginning and ending*

For I have told him that I will judge his house for ever for the iniquity which he knoweth; because his sons made themselves vile, and he restrained them not.+ 3.13 For I…: or, And I will tell him*+ 3.13 vile: or, accursed*+ 3.13 restrained…: Heb. frowned not upon them*
And therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli’s house shall not be purged with sacrifice nor offering for ever.
¶ And Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**. And Samuel feared to shew Eli the vision.
Then Eli called Samuel, and said, Samuel, my son. And he answered, Here am* I.

And he said, What is* the thing that the \+nd Lord\+nd** hath said unto thee? I pray thee hide it* not from me: God do so to thee, and more also, if thou hide any* thing from me of all the things that he said unto thee.+ 3.17 more also: Heb. so add*+ 3.17 thing: or, word*
And Samuel told him every whit, and hid nothing from him. And he said, It is* the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**: let him do what seemeth him good.+ 3.18 every…: Heb. all the things, or, words*
¶ And Samuel grew, and the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** was with him, and did let none of his words fall to the ground.
And all Israel from Dan even to Beer-sheba knew that Samuel was* established to be* a prophet of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**.+ 3.20 established: or, faithful*
And the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** appeared again in Shiloh: for the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w** revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the \+w LORD strong="H3068"\+w**.
